attributes.title: Roles and responsibilities not assigned during elasticsearch production incident
attributes.summary: The incident involving the elasticsearch-prod service began on August 28, 2025, at 9:09 PM UTC, classified as SEV2, but no specific root cause has been determined as of yet. The severity of the issue could potentially impact customers, though details on that have not been provided. The incident was reported by JP Cheung, and so far, no roles such as Commander or Executive Sponsor have been assigned to manage the situation, nor have action items been allocated to individuals, leaving several tasks unresolved including updating the incident summary and communicating with customers.

attributes.name: SEV2
attributes.description: Stability or **minor customer-impacting issues** that require immediate attention from service owners, _e.g. 1 node failed_

attributes.resolution_message: The incident report indicates that roles and responsibilities were not assigned during the elasticsearch production incident, and while the status is marked as "Resolved," it is unclear if any actions were completed or if the resolution was effective in addressing the situation. Therefore, the specifics of how the incident was resolved remain ambiguous.

attributes.name: SEV0
attributes.description: **Critical issue** that warrants public notification and liaison with executive teams, _e.g. whole site outage_
